member.name: T:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx
member.summary: Special wrapper which allow us to control access to stream and cache data. Our implementation fix bug of NET BufferedStream class: on Position property set class reset internal cache. Our class detect situations when reset of cache not needed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._s
member.summary: Underlying stream. Close sets _s to null.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._buffer
member.summary: Shared read/write buffer. Alloc on first use.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._readLen
member.summary: Number of bytes read in buffer from _s.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._bufferSize
member.summary: Length of internal buffer, if it's allocated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx._streamPos
member.summary: Stream position on moment of buffer read

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. hidden to class users.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initialize class by stream and DefaultBufferSize == 4096.
member.param: Stream which our class must wrap

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize class by instance of stream and user defined cache size
member.param: Stream which our class must wrap
member.exception: stream does not support Read and Write operations
bufferSize is equel or less of zero

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read data from stream. If data is cached then class will not call wrapped stream and simple returned copy of cached data.
member.param: offset in output buffer where data from stream must be placed
count of bytes which class must return

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the underlying stream. Returns the byte cast to an int or -1 if reading from the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write portion of data into wrapped stream. If data can be placed into cache then it will be there and only on Flush operation data will be saved to wrapped stream.
member.param: offset to the beginning of the portion of data
number of bytes in the portion of data
member.exception: If array or stream is null
If offset or count is less than zero
If array does not contain required elements count

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Write on byte of information into stream.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seek operation. On any seek operation not written data from cache will be flushed to wrapped stream. Better use Position property it optimized for cache use.
member.exception: If can't seek in the stream

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Close
member.summary: Save all data from cache and Close stream.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.FlushRead
member.summary: Reading is done by blocks from the file, but someone could read 1 byte from the buffer then write. At that point, the OS's file pointer is out of sync with the stream's position. All write functions should call this function to preserve the position in the file.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.FlushWrite
member.summary: Writes are buffered. Anytime the buffer fills up (_writePos + delta > _bufferSize) or the buffer switches to reading and there is dirty data (_writePos > 0), this function must be called.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.exception: When value is less than zero
If can't seek or can't write into stream

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanRead
member.summary: Indicate can be data readed from wrapped stream. TRUE - data can be readed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanWrite
member.summary: Indicate can data be written to wrapped stream.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicate does wrapped stream support Seek operations or not

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Length
member.summary: Get Length of wrapped stream. On property value get class Flush not written to stream data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.Position
member.summary: Get current position of stream. Position can be differ then wrapped stream has, because wrapped stream will point on last byte of our cached data. On property set not written data flushed to stream.
member.exception: wrapped stream does not support seek operation

member.name: P:Syncfusion.IO.BufferedStreamEx.BaseStream
member.summary: Get reference on stream wrapped by BufferStreamEx
